basics.name: Chuyi Hou
basics.label: Master of Engineer, Game Developer
basics.summary: Applied Machine Learning Engineer with a passion for utilizing cutting-edge models to develop innovative solutions. I specialize in leveraging advancements in machine learning, including large language models(LLMs), to create impactful systems that improve user experience and system functionality. With aforward-thinking approach, I focus on maximizing the potential of rapidly evolving models to addressreal-world challenges. My expertise spans from developing and fine-tuning machine learning algorithmsto deploying practical, efficient solutions across diverse applications, ensuring my work remains at theforefront of the field.

work.name: Unmodal Research Inc.
work.position: Signal Processing and Machine Learning Engineer
work.summary: Experienced Signal Processing and Machine Learning Engineer adept in hardware assembly, firmware development, and signal analysis. Expertise in assembling hardware components, creating robust firmware and software interfaces, and implementing advanced signal processing techniques. One of the achievements I am proud of is enabling microcontrollers for multichannel audio output. Bridging the gap between theory and practice, I optimize system performance and contribute to innovative solutions.

volunteer.organization: Engineering Science Club at University of Toronto
volunteer.summary: Volunteered at UofT Open house as one of Engineering Science program student ambassadors.

volunteer.summary: Volunteered at Ontario University Fair as one of Engineering Science program student ambassadors.

publications.name: pressAR : Vision-based Freehand Touch and Force Sensing
publications.publisher: Perumal Varun Chadalavada, Chuyi Hou, Harishguna Satgunarajah, and Nirmal Pol, Yining Liu, Daniel Wigdor
publications.summary: pressAR enhances gesture input using computer vision and machine learning to improve ergonomics and usability for prolonged use in augmented reality (AR).
